item.description:
We're pleased to announce a special gathering of our Cambridge Semantic Web Meetup. We'll be meeting next Thursday, September 22, for a special session with two great speakers talking about their work with unstructured text, text mining, NLP,

First, we have Antonio Linari visiting our region from Italy for a few weeks. Antonio is the CTO of ADmantX, and will be presenting:

  • Semantic approach to Categorization by Partial Disambiguation (CPD)

Then, we're very pleased to have Raul Rodriguez-Esteban, a Senior Scientist at Boehringer Ingelheim, traveling up from Connecticut to present on his work using text analytics in pharma:

  • Looking objectively at what is important in a new target

We're honored to have both speakers joining us from quite a distance, and we hope you can join us and enjoy the session!
item.name: Special Meetup: Semantics & NLP
